title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.38 | 24-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

In this session we will be discussing from the 38th verse of the 15th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
स्वराट् पौत्रं बिनैनं आत्मनः सुसमं गुनैहि तोय नीव्याः पतिम् भूमेर् अभ्यसिंचत् गजाह्वये
The meaning of this 38th verse is
Thereafter in the capital of Hastinapura he enthroned his grandson who was trained and equally qualified as the emperor and master of all land bordered by the seas.
So here is the description of Yudhishthira Maharaj retiring.
From active household life and he is handing over charge of ruling the world to his trained and qualified grandson, Parikshit Maharaj.
Parikshit Maharaj was only surviving descendant of the Pandava family of the Kuru dynasty.
Everyone else was killed in the battle of Kurukshetra.
So Yudhishthira Maharaj handed over charge to Parikshit Maharaj and he handed over charge as the emperor and master of all lands bordered by the seas.
The whole world.
He handed over charge of ruling the entire world to Parikshit Maharaj.
Srila Prabhupada says in the purport,
The total land on the earth bordered by the seas was under the subjugation of the king of the Kuru dynasty.
The king of Hastinapura.
This is the arrangement.
The emperor of the world ruled from the place called Hastinapura.
Hastinapura is modern day Delhi.
Elsewhere Srila Prabhupada explains.
So the capital was always in Hastinapura.
Of the rulers of the entire world.
There was subordination.
There was subordination.
There were subordinate kings.
And they had their smaller jurisdiction of province or state or some small kingdom.
But they were always subordinate to the emperor.
So that was actually the system.
That there were different territorial kings who were protected by the emperor.
Against any invasion by rogues and thieves and dacoits etc.
So they used to rule the citizens very nicely.
According to the scriptural directions.
According to the kshatriya dharma.
The perfect system of administration.
Given in the perfect scriptures.
Coming from the perfect source.
The supreme personality of Godhead.
So Srila Prabhupada further says.
Maharaja Yudhishtira trained his grandson Maharaj Pariksit.
Who was equally qualified in state administration.
In terms of the king's obligation to the citizens.
Earlier Srila Prabhupada elaborately explained.
What were the obligations of the king to the citizens.
The king had to essentially.
Ensure that all the necessities were provided for the citizens.
So that the citizens can actually become.
Responsible.
For preparing themselves to go back to Godhead.
After having achieved or.
After having received a human form of life.
So human form of life means a life of responsibility.
And the king ensures that people.
Take advantage of this human form of life.
By becoming very responsible.
Not that they are busy simply earning money.
Or busy with some material activities.
Busy with some sense gratification.
All under the influence of the illusory energy.
For some temporary effects.
No.
Human being means.
Should understand.
The difference between.
The temporary and permanent.
Material and spiritual.
Body and soul.
Matter and spirit.
Clear difference or distinction should be made.
And the human being as the developed.
Consciousness or intelligence or brain substance.
To actually be able to do this.
Under proper guidance.
Therefore scriptures say.
Approach a bonafide spiritual master.
Who is.
Who is.
Self realized.
And who has seen the truth.
Who is.
Who is conversant with.
The subject spiritual subject matter.
By having.
Properly studied it under.
Another bonafide spiritual master.
In discipline succession coming from Krishna.

So, unless we are guided by a God-conscious king, administrator, ruler.
Unless we approach a bona fide spiritual master after receiving such guidance.
As to real goal of human life is to go back home, back to Godhead.
To get out of this material existence, which is temporary and filled with miseries.
And go to that place where there are no miseries.
Which is full of bliss.
Which is permanent, eternal, abode full of bliss and knowledge.

So, it is specifically told Maharaj Pariksit was trained in state administration in terms of the king's obligation to the citizens.
Thus, Pariksit Maharaj was enthroned on the seat of Maharaj Yudhishthira.
Prior to Yudhishthira's departure, back to Godhead.
Now, concerning Maharaj Pariksit, one word is used, Vinayinam.
The reason is, this Vinayinam means properly trained.
He was trained to actually ensure the happiness of the citizens.
Which was due to the king's obligation to the citizens.
Which was due to ample production of natural produce, such as grains, fruits, milk, herbs, valuable stones, minerals, and everything that the people needed.
They were even free from bodily miseries, anxieties of mind, disturbances caused by natural phenomena, and other living beings.
So, this was the standard of administration when Yudhishthira Maharaj ruling, Pariksit Maharaj ruling.
This was the standard.
Because everyone was happy in all respects, there was no resentment.
Although there were sometimes battles between kings, different state kings, for political reasons and supremacy.
So, people were trained to attain the highest goal of life.
And therefore, they were enlightened enough not to quarrel over some trivial material things.
So, the influence of the Indian people was not enough.
They were trained to achieve the highest goal of life.
